verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came again unto me, saying <S%H559><s%>,
Now, thou son <S%H1121><s%> of man <S%H120><s%>, take up <S%H5375><s%> a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for Tyrus <S%H6865><s%>;

And say <S%H559><s%> unto Tyrus <S%H6865><s%>, O thou that art situate <S%H3427><s%> at the entry <S%H3997><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, which art a merchant <S%H7402><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> for many <S%H7227><s%> isles <S%H339><s%>, Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%>; O Tyrus <S%H6865><s%>, thou hast said <S%H559><s%>, I am of perfect <S%H3632><s%> beauty <S%H3308><s%>.
Thy borders <S%H1366><s%> are in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%>, thy builders <S%H1129><s%> have perfected <S%H3634><s%> thy beauty <S%H3308><s%>.

They have made <S%H1129><s%> all thy ship boards <S%H3871><s%> of fir trees <S%H1265><s%> of Senir <S%H8149><s%>: they have taken <S%H3947><s%> cedars <S%H730><s%> from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> to make <S%H6213><s%> masts <S%H8650><s%> for thee.

Of the oaks <S%H437><s%> of Bashan <S%H1316><s%> have they made <S%H6213><s%> thine oars <S%H4880><s%>; the company <S%H1323><s%> of the Ashurites <S%H839><s%> have made <S%H6213><s%> thy benches <S%H7175><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%>, brought out of the isles <S%H339><s%> of Chittim <S%H3794><s%>.

Fine linen <S%H8336><s%> with broidered work <S%H7553><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%> was that which thou spreadest forth <S%H4666><s%> to be thy sail <S%H5251><s%>; blue <S%H8504><s%> and purple <S%H713><s%> from the isles <S%H339><s%> of Elishah <S%H473><s%> was that which covered <S%H4374><s%> thee.

The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Zidon <S%H6721><s%> and Arvad <S%H719><s%> were thy mariners <S%H7751><s%>: thy wise <S%H2450><s%> men, O Tyrus <S%H6865><s%>, that were in thee, were thy pilots <S%H2259><s%>.

The ancients <S%H2205><s%> of Gebal <S%H1380><s%> and the wise <S%H2450><s%> men thereof were in thee thy calkers <S%H919><s%> <S%H2388><s%>: all the ships <S%H591><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> with their mariners <S%H4419><s%> were in thee to occupy <S%H6148><s%> thy merchandise <S%H4627><s%>.

They of Persia <S%H6539><s%> and of Lud <S%H3865><s%> and of Phut <S%H6316><s%> were in thine army <S%H2428><s%>, thy men <S%H582><s%> of war <S%H4421><s%>: they hanged <S%H8518><s%> the shield <S%H4043><s%> and helmet <S%H3553><s%> in thee; they set forth <S%H5414><s%> thy comeliness <S%H1926><s%>.

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Arvad <S%H719><s%> with thine army <S%H2428><s%> were upon thy walls <S%H2346><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%>, and the Gammadims <S%H1575><s%> were in thy towers <S%H4026><s%>: they hanged <S%H8518><s%> their shields <S%H7982><s%> upon thy walls <S%H2346><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%>; they have made <S%H3634><s%> thy beauty <S%H3308><s%> perfect <S%H3634><s%>.

Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> was thy merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all kind of riches <S%H1952><s%>; with silver <S%H3701><s%>, iron <S%H1270><s%>, tin <S%H913><s%>, and lead <S%H5777><s%>, they traded <S%H5414><s%> in thy fairs <S%H5801><s%>.

Javan <S%H3120><s%>, Tubal <S%H8422><s%>, and Meshech <S%H4902><s%>, they were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%>: they traded <S%H5414><s%> the persons <S%H5315><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> and vessels <S%H3627><s%> of brass <S%H5178><s%> in thy market <S%H4627><s%>.
They of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Togarmah <S%H8425><s%> traded <S%H5414><s%> in thy fairs <S%H5801><s%> with horses <S%H5483><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> and mules <S%H6505><s%>.

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Dedan <S%H1719><s%> were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%>; many <S%H7227><s%> isles <S%H339><s%> were the merchandise <S%H5506><s%> of thine hand <S%H3027><s%>: they brought <S%H7725><s%> thee for a present <S%H814><s%> horns <S%H7161><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%> and ebony <S%H1894><s%>.

Syria <S%H758><s%> was thy merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the wares of thy making <S%H4639><s%>: they occupied <S%H5414><s%> in thy fairs <S%H5801><s%> with emeralds <S%H5306><s%>, purple <S%H713><s%>, and broidered work <S%H7553><s%>, and fine linen <S%H948><s%>, and coral <S%H7215><s%>, and agate <S%H3539><s%>.

Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and the land <S%H776><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, they were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%>: they traded <S%H5414><s%> in thy market <S%H4627><s%> wheat <S%H2406><s%> of Minnith <S%H4511><s%>, and Pannag <S%H6436><s%>, and honey <S%H1706><s%>, and oil <S%H8081><s%>, and balm <S%H6875><s%>.

Damascus <S%H1834><s%> was thy merchant <S%H5503><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the wares of thy making <S%H4639><s%>, for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all riches <S%H1952><s%>; in the wine <S%H3196><s%> of Helbon <S%H2463><s%>, and white <S%H6713><s%> wool <S%H6785><s%>.

Dan <S%H2051><s%> <S%H1835><s%> also and Javan <S%H3120><s%> going to and fro <S%H235><s%> occupied <S%H5414><s%> in thy fairs <S%H5801><s%>: bright <S%H6219><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%>, cassia <S%H6916><s%>, and calamus <S%H7070><s%>, were in thy market <S%H4627><s%>.
Dedan <S%H1719><s%> was thy merchant <S%H7402><s%> in precious <S%H2667><s%> clothes <S%H899><s%> for chariots <S%H7396><s%>.

Arabia <S%H6152><s%>, and all the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Kedar <S%H6938><s%>, they occupied <S%H5503><s%> with thee <S%H3027><s%> in lambs <S%H3733><s%>, and rams <S%H352><s%>, and goats <S%H6260><s%>: in these were they thy merchants <S%H5503><s%>.

The merchants <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> and Raamah <S%H7484><s%>, they were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%>: they occupied <S%H5414><s%> in thy fairs <S%H5801><s%> with chief <S%H7218><s%> of all spices <S%H1314><s%>, and with all precious <S%H3368><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>, and gold <S%H2091><s%>.

Haran <S%H2771><s%>, and Canneh <S%H3656><s%>, and Eden <S%H5729><s%>, the merchants <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%>, Asshur <S%H804><s%>, and Chilmad <S%H3638><s%>, were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%>.

These were thy merchants <S%H7402><s%> in all sorts <S%H4360><s%> of things, in blue <S%H8504><s%> clothes <S%H1545><s%>, and broidered work <S%H7553><s%>, and in chests <S%H1595><s%> of rich apparel <S%H1264><s%>, bound <S%H2280><s%> with cords <S%H2256><s%>, and made of cedar <S%H729><s%>, among thy merchandise <S%H4819><s%>.

The ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> did sing <S%H7788><s%> of thee in thy market <S%H4627><s%>: and thou wast replenished <S%H4390><s%>, and made very <S%H3966><s%> glorious <S%H3513><s%> in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%>.

Â¶ Thy rowers <S%H7751><s%> have brought <S%H935><s%> thee into great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>: the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> hath broken <S%H7665><s%> thee in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%>.

Thy riches <S%H1952><s%>, and thy fairs <S%H5801><s%>, thy merchandise <S%H4627><s%>, thy mariners <S%H4419><s%>, and thy pilots <S%H2259><s%>, thy calkers <S%H919><s%> <S%H2388><s%>, and the occupiers <S%H6148><s%> of thy merchandise <S%H4627><s%>, and all thy men <S%H582><s%> of war <S%H4421><s%>, that are in thee, and in all thy company <S%H6951><s%> which is in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of thee, shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of thy ruin <S%H4658><s%>.
The suburbs <S%H4054><s%> shall shake <S%H7493><s%> at the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the cry <S%H2201><s%> of thy pilots <S%H2259><s%>.

And all that handle <S%H8610><s%> the oar <S%H4880><s%>, the mariners <S%H4419><s%>, and all the pilots <S%H2259><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, shall come down <S%H3381><s%> from their ships <S%H591><s%>, they shall stand <S%H5975><s%> upon the land <S%H776><s%>;

And shall cause their voice <S%H6963><s%> to be heard <S%H8085><s%> against thee, and shall cry <S%H2199><s%> bitterly <S%H4751><s%>, and shall cast up <S%H5927><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> upon their heads <S%H7218><s%>, they shall wallow <S%H6428><s%> themselves in the ashes <S%H665><s%>:

And they shall make themselves utterly <S%H7144><s%> bald <S%H7139><s%> for thee, and gird <S%H2296><s%> them with sackcloth <S%H8242><s%>, and they shall weep <S%H1058><s%> for thee with bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of heart <S%H5315><s%> and bitter <S%H4751><s%> wailing <S%H4553><s%>.

And in their wailing <S%H5204><s%> they shall take up <S%H5375><s%> a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for thee, and lament <S%H6969><s%> over thee, saying, What city is like Tyrus <S%H6865><s%>, like the destroyed <S%H1822><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>?

When thy wares <S%H5801><s%> went forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the seas <S%H3220><s%>, thou filledst <S%H7646><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>; thou didst enrich <S%H6238><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy riches <S%H1952><s%> and of thy merchandise <S%H4627><s%>.

In the time <S%H6256><s%> when thou shalt be broken <S%H7665><s%> by the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the depths <S%H4615><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> thy merchandise <S%H4627><s%> and all thy company <S%H6951><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of thee shall fall <S%H5307><s%>.

All the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the isles <S%H339><s%> shall be astonished <S%H8074><s%> at thee, and their kings <S%H4428><s%> shall be sore <S%H8178><s%> afraid <S%H8175><s%>, they shall be troubled <S%H7481><s%> in their countenance <S%H6440><s%>.
The merchants <S%H5503><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%> shall hiss <S%H8319><s%> at thee; thou shalt be a terror <S%H1091><s%>, and never shalt be any more <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5769><s%>.
